results.title: A Visit to the hospital
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The wonderful world of Paddington Bear”.
Paddington Bear at large in a hospital fails to find Mr Curry, the patient, but gets to see a psychiatrist instead. Amusing word association games follow. Animated by Ivor Wood. Suitable for lower and middle primary levels.
results.description:

results.title: Paddington turns detective
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The wonderful world of Paddington Bear”.
Paddington receives a torch from Mr Gruber as a gift and receives an answer to his morse code signals from Mr. Brown’s greenhouse! He assumes the identity of Feathers Locke, Detective and proceeds to investigate, even fingerprinting Mr. Brown’s prize marrow! Adapted from Michael Bond’s book ‘More about Paddington’. Narrated by Michael Hordern. Music by Herbert Chappel.
results.description:

results.title: Mr Gruber's mystery tour
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The wonderful world of Paddington Bear”.
Adapted from chapter 4 from the book “Paddington marches on” by Michael Bond. Mr Gruber takes Paddington on a visit to the Wax Museum where Paddington is astonished and amazed at what he sees. Paddington has never visited the Wax Musem before. Narrated by Michael Hordern.
results.description:
Episode of Series “The wonderful world of Paddington Bear”.

results.title: The Woodlanders
results.creator_credit: Phil Agland, Barney Reisz, Channel Four and Pathe Productions
results.brief_description: Based on the novel by Thomas Hardy, “The Woodlanders” is a passionate story of love. Giles Winterborne (Rufus Sewell) and Grace Melbury (Emily Woof) have had an agreement to marry since childhood. However, Grace’s return from boarding school and subsequent elevation in society cause their engagement to be called off. Silently adored by his friend, Marty, Giles continues to pine for Grace, whilst she in turn falls in love with the handsome new doctor, Fitzpiers. But as they follow their separate courses, Grace and Giles find that their lives become inextricably entwined.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Phil Agland, Barney Reisz, Channel Four and Pathe Productions

results.title: Tuktu and the trials of strength
results.creator_credit: Laurence Hyde, David Bairstow and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Stories of Tuktu”.
Strong and hardy Inuit hunters demonstrate and test their strength in boxing, tug-of-war, and other strenuous activities. We see and hear the drum dance, a demonstration of Inuit poetry and rhythm.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Laurence Hyde, David Bairstow and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: Tuktu and the clever hands
results.creator_credit: Laurence Hyde, David Bairstow and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Stories of Tuktu”.
A general look at some of the things made by the Inuit and a commentary on the clever use that they make of the few materials that are available in their harsh environment. We come to the conclusion that they are highly skilled, overcoming problems that to us would seem almost insurmountable.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Laurence Hyde, David Bairstow and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: Tuktu and the indoor games
results.creator_credit: Laurence Hyde, David Bairstow and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Stories of Tuktu”.
A happy, joyous look at the Inuit and the games they play in the big igloo. Outside, the wind and blizzard howl, but Tuktu’s family and friends ignore the weather. They juggle stones, skip and play with a delightful Inuit child. Finally Tuktu falls asleep and dreams about the good time he has had.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Laurence Hyde, David Bairstow and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: Tuktu and the caribou hunt
results.creator_credit: Laurence Hyde, David Bairstow and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Stories of Tuktu”.
When the caribou cross the small lakes to reach new grazing ground, the Inuit hunt the animals from their kayaks. Tuktu’s father has bad luck with his hunting and a caribou escapes his spear. But we see him bringing one home, and the film ends with an outdoor fire and everyone enjoying a feast.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Laurence Hyde, David Bairstow and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: Tuktu and his animal friends
results.creator_credit: Laurence Hyde, David Bairstow and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Stories of Tuktu”.
In this film we look at the smaller animals that live in the Arctic, including lemmings, weasels, ducks and kittiwakes. It also includes material on flowers. Tuktu’s father climbs the high cliffs in search of gulls’ eggs.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Laurence Hyde, David Bairstow and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: Tuktu and the magic spear
results.creator_credit: Laurence Hyde, David Bairstow and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Stories of Tuktu”.
Tuktu accompanies his family when fishing is done through the ice during the long cold winter. He also sees his father catch fish with a spear during the summer, Tuktu longs to grow up and spear fish too.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Laurence Hyde, David Bairstow and National Film Board of Canada
